en.purpose:
To provide evidence-based decision support for safe dental procedures in pregnant patients by:

Monitoring maternal vitals and gestational age.

Avoiding contraindicated medications and imaging.

Suggesting safe local anaesthetic choices.

Supporting trimester-specific dental care recommendations.
en.use:
This guideline is intended for use by:

Dentists and dental surgeons treating pregnant patients.

Clinical staff involved in maternal oral healthcare.

Educational and training settings for demonstrating pregnancy-focused CDS.
en.misuse:
Should not be used as a substitute for clinical judgment.

Not intended for non-pregnant patients or general anaesthesia guidance.

Should not be applied without considering individual patient conditions and comorbidities.

Data quality issues (e.g., missing vitals or wrong gestational age) may lead to invalid results.

gt0001.description:
Clinical Decision Support System guideline for pregnancy-related dental care.
It integrates maternal vital signs (blood pressure, pulse, temperature), gestational age, medical history, dental assessment, imaging, patient positioning, and planned local anaesthesia.
The purpose is to ensure safe dental procedures during pregnancy by validating vital ranges, checking trimester-specific risks, and recommending safe anaesthetic agents.
